title: Brigitte Bardot: A Famous Actress Who Loved Animals
summary: Brigitte Bardot was a famous French actress who died at age 91. She was a big star in movies during the 1950s and became known for her beauty and freedom. She acted in almost 50 films, including a popular one called And God Created Woman. In 1973, she stopped acting to help animals. She started the Brigitte Bardot Foundation to protect animals. The French President said she was a legend, and many people remembered her for her work with animals. She was born in Paris in 1934 and became famous after being on a magazine cover. Later in life, she said some mean things that hurt her reputation. She was married to a man named Bernard d'Ormale.

background_read: Brigitte Bardot was a famous actress from France who lived from 1934 to 2025. She became a star in the 1950s by acting in movies that showed her as free and beautiful. Many people admired her, but she also faced criticism for saying hurtful things. After retiring from acting, she spent her life helping animals through her foundation. This article talks about her life, her work, and how people remember her.
